meanings.definition: To bring to a premature end because of a problem or fault.
meanings.sent1: She was aborting the mission due to bad weather conditions.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to abort the recipe when he realized he was missing a key ingredient.
meanings.sent3: The magician was aborting his disappearing act halfway through, leaving the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to abort the experiment when the chemicals reacted unexpectedly.
meanings.sent5: The team captain made the tough call to abort the game due to the unsafe field conditions.

meanings.definition: To stop a process or activity before it is completed.
meanings.sent1: The computer program was aborting the download because of a poor internet connection.
meanings.sent2: She had to abort her workout early due to a sudden muscle cramp.
meanings.sent3: The kids were aborting their game of tag to go get some ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to abort the project halfway through due to budget constraints.
meanings.sent5: He had to quickly abort the phone call when his boss walked into the room.

meanings.definition: To terminate a pregnancy before the fetus is viable.
meanings.sent1: The doctor was aborting the pregnancy to protect the mother's health.
meanings.sent2: She made the difficult decision to abort the pregnancy after consulting with her partner.
meanings.sent3: The couple was aborting their vacation plans due to unexpected news.
meanings.sent4: The young woman chose to abort the pregnancy after careful consideration.
meanings.sent5: The clinic offered counseling services for those considering aborting a pregnancy.
